programmes.show_description: This Cursed Hand: A missing persons case turns to murder as Frank and Lu investigate the disappearance of an Eastern European oligarch.
Waterloo Part 2: In the last-ever episode of the detective drama, the team tries to determine why Nicholson may be protecting the killer, and Sarah goes missing.
The Harder They Fall: Ageless comedy with Ronnie Barker behind bars at Slade. Godber enters the prison boxing championships, and although he is the hot favourite, he must lose.
Mice: Comedy with Chigwell's most famous sisters. Tracey's plan to hold a perfume-selling party hits a major snag when Sharon discovers some furry gate-crashers.
Home, Sweet Home: A career criminal terrorises the Sixth Ward, and Detective Corcoran must put an end to his reign of violence.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Brief Encounter: More laughs with the Essex sisters. A beautiful friendship begins for Sharon when she sees off a mugger who is attacking a businessman in Chigwell railway station.
Love and War: Part 1: Garfield is anxious to know where he stands with Jenny. Quinnan is behaving strangely, and seems to have something to hide.
New. Mama Sings the Blues: A former singer and old friend visits Julia for help reconnecting with her pop star daughter, and Jimmi keeps busy by taking on more work.
New. Gathering Light: Jimmi helps a patient with bipolar disorder who has come off her medication because she is pregnant. Michelle prepares for a blind date, but the man does not turn up.
What He Would Have Wanted: Tom's conscience is pricked over a transplant, Ed's father is released from prison and turns up at the hospital, while Kath finally has something to smile about.
I Am Mine: Lenny and Yuki go to extreme measures to find evidence of the drug trial cover-up. Zoe tries to end her relationship with Jordan. A surprise reunion leaves Charlie devastated.
Love and War: Part 1: Garfield is anxious to know where he stands with Jenny. Quinnan is behaving strangely, and seems to have something to hide.
New. Glenda is thrown when Ronnie turns up unexpectedly at her flat, but she has a bombshell of her own for her daughter. Jane vows not to give up on a distraught Ian.
New. Pat's decision to deal with Janine has disastrous results for all concerned. Peggy is horrified by Roxy, and Denise decides to play her rival at her own game.
Will to Live: There'll be tears before bedtime when the 1930s vets face a heartbreaking job in the classic drama series. A man has to be told that his dog has lost its sight.
Sir Edward waits for Jan's reply to his proposal, and Abby returns.
Beware the Ides of March: Two TV psychics are convinced someone is trying to kill them, and the suspects range from the studio security guard to an angry ex-fan.
A Storm in a Teacup: Fletch lands in hot water when stolen pills accidentally find their way into his cup of tea. Mr Mackay is determined to get to the bottom of it. Contains adult humour.
The General's Greatest Battle: The young at heart sitcom. The lifelike effigy of the old General has been spruced up for the annual parade. Nora is to be on a float playing his wife!
Spores: Popular sitcom starring Peter Sallis of Wallace and Gromit fame. Lionel has a habit of being unpredictable, so when he abandons his wife in the hills she isn't too surprised.
Happy Birthday Robin Hood: More senior silliness in the long-running sitcom. To celebrate the birthday of his famous ancestor, Robin Hood, Billy proudly wears a green suit.
The Sins Of Others: The priest has his work cut out thanks to Sid, who is released from prison, but then accused of murdering his former defence barrister in a ghastly manner.
The Theatre Of The Invisible: When popular radio quiz Up To You comes to Kembleford, the sleuthing padre suspects that one of the cast are responsible for their landlady's murder.
The old-fashioned, 'no-nonsense' cop team unravel another tricky mystery. Looking into three mysterious disappearances, the team believe a serial killer is on the loose.
Beware the Ides of March: Two TV psychics are convinced someone is trying to kill them, and the suspects range from the studio security guard to an angry ex-fan.
The Unwanted: Warren Clarke stars in the compelling and popular crime drama series. Pascoe returns home to attend the wedding of a childhood friend where a murder takes place.
A Storm in a Teacup: Fletch lands in hot water when stolen pills accidentally find their way into his cup of tea. Mr Mackay is determined to get to the bottom of it. Contains adult humour.
The Cape Town Prostitute Killer: Micki returns to Cape Town, where a serial killer has been targeting prostitutes. When a suspect emerges, a confession is needed fast.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Substitute: More laughs with the Chigwell sisters. Tracey finds herself attracted to another man for the first time since her husband went to prison.
Sailing: More laughs with the Essex lasses. The prospect of a happy festive season looks bleak for Tracey and Sharon while their fellas are banged up at Her Majesty's pleasure.
Getting a Grip: Series two of the most famous sitcom in Essex - isn't it? Sharon and Tracey turn to their man-hungry neighbour Dorien for help when their central heating breaks down.
Raise the Hispanic: Drama with the roguish wheeler dealer. Lovejoy overhears a row at a wedding between the groom and his father-in-law, before the newly-married man turns up dead!
Lily's Pearls: Vintage 90s drama with the rascally antiques expert. Lovejoy smells a rat when he meets a developer who wants to go into business with Lady Jane's husband.
Black Virgin of Vladimir - Part One: Absorbing drama with the denim-clad fox. Lovejoy plans an complex 'sting' when he learns that a widow and a businessman have been swindled.
The Sins Of Others: The priest has his work cut out thanks to Sid, who is released from prison, but then accused of murdering his former defence barrister in a ghastly manner.
Left Field: Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman star in the hugely popular mystery series. A recently paroled prisoner confesses to the abduction of a child 25 years previously.
Dark Chocolate: The popular crime caper with some of the nation's favourite actors, including Dennis Waterman and James Bolam. The team probe an attack at a chocolate factory.
The Problem at Gallows Gate, Part 2: Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin star in the mystery drama. The two-part story concludes, but has a murder been committed by a dead man?
Death Comes To Marlow Part 1: A wealthy baronet dies alone in his study the day before his wedding and Judith, Becks and Suzie find themselves at the centre of another mystery.
Death Comes To Marlow Part 2: As the suspects' alibis stack up, Judith, Becks and Suzie are pushed to their limits. Can they solve the murder before anyone else gets hurt?
Old Blood Money: Mike and the team discover more than one dead body, and a significant amount of family rivalry, in the manor home of a pair of ageing siblings.
A fox runs through Whitechapel with a human arm in its mouth, but Chandler and the team struggle to identify the murder victim.
A Cry for Justice: Nathaniel Parker stars in the gripping murder mystery series from the mind of Elizabeth George. A murder in Oxford takes Lynley away from home and his wife.
